title: Sony's voice chat policy is more than welcome. Hate speech has no place in 2020.

author: RANDOMHOLLOW
text: If someone goes on a racist rant in voice chat why shouldn't they be banned? "Oh but its freedom of speech" stfu. If you're not spewing racism and hate in your voice chats you're fine. Ive been on the receiving end of it plenty of times and I'm glad they're doing this.

author: touchtheclouds
text: Freedom of speech also doesn't apply to platforms and services. Companies can make rules about speech on their platforms. Anyone claiming "freedom of speech" doesn't even understand what that really means.

author: TrickyBoss4
text:
Freedom of speech the law doesn't apply to platforms.

Freedom of speech as a concept can apply to whatever platform you're speaking on.

author: DoctorCheif15
text:
This is the same response I use to people who say "but..
But... OUR PRIVACY!!!"

author: BlagzBets
text: Sorry people don’t like big brother watching over them? Companies can do it but don’t be surprised with a negative response lol

author: SymphonicRain
text: Seems a bit odd referring to private companies as big brother. I also don’t totally like the idea really but yeah I don’t really see how this is big brother, especially since the recordings are being stored client-side.

author: BlagzBets
text: Okay then take out the term big brother lol. I don’t want any govt or company having a play in my privacy. Who knew that’d be a controversial statement lol.

author: camdencapone
text: Do you have a cell phone? Because if you do you have no privacy and your govt can monitor your voice and track your location. Funny how people seem to forget that shit.

author: camdencapone
text: I can tell you genuinely dont understand, because if you actually read what Sony is doing, you would know what they are doing is not even close to what Facebook does. Not even a little bit.

author: NawYiDidny
text:
And yet they still buy the consoles. Still buy the TVs. Still buy the tablets and smart phones.

Practice what you preach. If you don't like it, throw out your console.

If it means that much, if it's a principle of yours then you must be quite fickle to just shrug it off.

"I don't like when people do this it's wrong!... but I'll go along with it anyway..." is not a respectable stance. So when you take it don't expect people to take you seriously.

author: G59_tilidie
text: So you’re saying he should throw away his playstation becuase A, sony did one thing he disagrees with, and B, to make random internet people take him seriously? Get off your friggin high horse buddy. Ya, sometimes things you love do things you don’t love, but you stick with it. This isn’t something to boycott over

author: NawYiDidny
text:
No. I'm saying he should throw away his PlayStation if he truly believes in this bullshit slippery slope Big brother theory.

If he truly believes its that dangerous and morally wrong he should be taking a stand.

Stand for nothing or fall for everything.

But he won't. Because deep down he doesn't really care. He's just bumping his gums and regurgitating rhetoric he's consumed from weird discord groups and shitty alt right gamers on twitch and YouTube and twitter etc etc.

I'm saying he doesn't _really_ care that much. So he shouldn't be pretending that he does.

text:

When you mock people for being concerned about that you just come off as a complete Sony fanboy that will do anything to defend his favorite company. It’s just weird.
